question_text: A large sphere has a volume of $288\pi$ cubic units.  A smaller sphere has a volume which is $12.5\%$ of the volume of the larger sphere.  What is the ratio of the radius of the smaller sphere to the radius of the larger sphere? Express your answer as a common fraction.
response:
The volume of the large sphere is $288 \pi.$ The volume of the small sphere is $12.5\%$ that, so the small sphere's volume is $\frac{12.5}{100} \cdot 288 \pi = \left(\frac{1}{8}\right) 288 \pi,$ which simplifies to $36 \pi$. This means that the ratio of their radii must be the cube root of $36\div 288$.
So we want $\sqrt[3]{36/288}=\boxed{\frac23}$
